metadata.description: A comprehensive, research-backed dataset representing the network of influence surrounding the State Financial Officers Foundation (SFOF). Now includes 'influence' for nodes and 'strength' for edges.

nodes.name: SFOF
nodes.description: State Financial Officers Foundation. A 501(c)(3) non-profit that acts as the central coordinating body for the anti-ESG campaign among state officials.

nodes.name: SFOF Action
nodes.description: The 501(c)(4) affiliate of SFOF, legally permitted to engage in unlimited lobbying and direct political campaign activities.

nodes.name: Derek Kreifels
nodes.description: Co-founder and CEO of SFOF. Later founded Prospr Aligned, a for-profit anti-ESG consultancy.

nodes.name: Leonard Leo
nodes.description: Conservative legal activist whose network is a central coordinating and funding hub for the anti-ESG ecosystem.

nodes.name: Bradley Foundation
nodes.description: The largest and most influential identifiable ideological funder of SFOF.

nodes.name: Bradley Impact Fund
nodes.description: A donor-advised fund affiliated with the Bradley Foundation, used to channel anonymous donations.

nodes.name: DonorsTrust
nodes.description: A major donor-advised fund, often called a 'dark money ATM,' that anonymizes the original source of funds for numerous conservative groups.

nodes.name: Sarah Scaife Foundation
nodes.description: A pillar of right-wing funding built on the Mellon industrial, oil, and banking fortune.

nodes.name: The Heritage Foundation
nodes.description: A leading conservative think tank that provides ideological legitimacy, hosts SFOF meetings, and co-develops model legislation.

nodes.name: ALEC
nodes.description: American Legislative Exchange Council. Creates and promotes model anti-ESG legislation in partnership with SFOF.

nodes.name: Consumers' Research
nodes.description: Acts as both a major funder to SFOF and its public-facing 'attack dog,' running aggressive ad campaigns against 'woke' companies.

nodes.name: Federated Hermes
nodes.description: A top-tier 'Gold' level sponsor of SFOF. Beneficiary of divestment from BlackRock by SFOF member Curtis Loftis.

nodes.name: Public Trust Advisors
nodes.description: 'Diamond' level sponsor of SFOF that appears to have benefited financially from anti-ESG legislation in Texas.

nodes.name: Curtis Loftis
nodes.description: South Carolina Treasurer and SFOF member. Divested state funds from non-donor BlackRock and moved them to SFOF-donor Federated Hermes.

nodes.name: Riley Moore
nodes.description: Then-West Virginia Treasurer who created the first 'Restricted Financial Institutions List,' providing a tactical blueprint for the SFOF network.

nodes.name: Glenn Hegar
nodes.description: Texas Comptroller responsible for implementing the state's anti-ESG 'energy boycott' law.

nodes.name: Marlo Oaks
nodes.description: Utah Treasurer who serves as a key public spokesman for the anti-ESG movement's ideological justifications.

edges.details: Operational partner that also acts as a major funder.
Massive funding that fuels its operations and grants to SFOF.
Leo's network funnels tens of millions to DonorsTrust, which then funds the ecosystem.
Shared leadership and collaboration on model legislation.
Institutional patronage, event hosting, and legislative development.
Divested from non-donor BlackRock and moved funds to Federated Hermes.
Implemented Texas SB 13, which created a favorable market for PTA.
